column4: hey guys, my gdm aint starting when i boot ubuntu on my mac mini, im droped in the shell, and have to start x with startx, how do i get to the login window on boot?
is it installed?
yeah it is
and what happens if you do /etc/init.d/gdm start?
it says its not the default manager
have you anotehr DM loaded/installed? ls -al /etc/rc2.d/S99*
there are things listed when i do taht,, ' ./init.d/rmnologin '
that rmnologin is ok. but there should be a S99gdm. if there isn't that's your problem. S99gdm should link back to /etc/init.d/gdm
didnt have any ending with gdm
what should i do?
no gdm in /etc/init.d/?
yeah i have gdm there
then link it to /etc/rc2/S99gdm. maybe use rcconf or such
are you telling me to do a ln -s /etc/init.d/gdm /etc/rc2/S99gdm
basically yes
im kindof newbie, so what do you mean wiht basically
use rcconf
and knowing how to use ln -s makes your more knowledgeable about linux than about 90% of the people in here
i found this  S13gdm -> ../init.d/gdm
isnt that what i was searching for before
acke sorta. but way too early imho
i dont get it
what is the error when you have all X closed and run /etc/init.d/gdm start ? check dmesg and syslog
okay i will look at that.
